vague_description: Optimizing the dosage and timing of a medication regimen for effective treatment.
detailed_description: A patient takes anxiety medication and anti-depressants one after the other. Each unit of anxiety medication takes \param{TAnxiety} minutes to be effective while each unit of anti-depressant takes \param{TAntiDepressant} minutes to be effective. The patient must take at least \param{MinUnits} units of medication and at least \param{MinAnxiety} should be anxiety medication. Since the anxiety medication is strong, the patient can take at most \param{MaxAnxietyAntiDepressantRatio} the amount of anxiety medication as anti-depressants. How many units of each should the patient take to minimize the total time it takes for the medication to be effective?
target_objective: Minimize the total time for the medication to be effective
target_constraints: Total units of medication is at least MinUnits
Anxiety medication units is at least MinAnxiety
Anxiety medication units is at most MaxAnxietyAntiDepressantRatio times the anti-depressant units
Number of anxiety medication units is non-negative
Number of anti-depressant units is non-negative
target_parameters: Time for anxiety medication to be effective
Time for anti-depressant to be effective
Minimum total units of medication required
Minimum units of anxiety medication required
Maximum ratio of anxiety medication units to anti-depressant units
